intro: Spilanthes beccabunga, commonly known as the narrowleaf pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It produces small, seed-like fruits called cypsela, which are dispersed by wind. Spilanthes beccabunga is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid environments.
